txt.en: 'You shall not find me so merciful then!'
'Let the loss of one of your brothers wound you as the loss of Dolgimil and Azruthor has wounded me.'
'May his death leave you undone.'
Instance: Blood for Blood
'Brother! At last you have come!'
'Erchar! Their numbers are thinning, but they still have a lot of fight in them.'
'Men and half-trolls have broken through the gate and pour in from Lebennin...'
'My men and I are wounded and must fall back to defend the innocents near the keep.'
'Look across the way! Garvir fights with spirit, but he cannot hold long by himself!'
'Hold the line! I shall send more men to your aid as soon as I am able!'
'They are breaking through!'
'We must reach him before it is too late!'
'They come from the north again! Let us drive them back!'
'They press their assault... we must hold!'
Look to the west, [placeholder]. More of them come for Linhir!'
'Our men cannot hold against so many... not after fighting for so long.'
'Their numbers are thinning, [placeholder], but I cannot take joy in this....'
'Let these dogs try to keep me from him!'
'We have lost so many. Shall anyone else take up arms to aid us?'
'We can hold it from here, Erchar. Your brother needs your aid by the river!'
'Curse you, speak true!'
'It was you that slew Dolgimil, worm!'
'We have broken their numbers to the north, at least for the moment....'
'Were it only that I had enough men to slay Linhir to the last...'
'Yet... the Corsairs still throw themselves at our western gate.'
'We must hold out as long as we are able, [placeholder], for their forces close on us from all sides.'
'...but they now sail on the coast, and when they are mine, I shall return for your brothers.'
'Let the shadow of my vengeance weigh upon you and your kin wherever they go.'
'Let us do what we can, [placeholder]... to arms!'
'Drown, you wretch!'
'Ahhhhh!'
'Come! We must reach Herion swiftly... let us hope they do not redouble their efforts here!'
'My brother! What has happened?'
'What was that? It sounded like the far gates were torn from their holdings! I fear more trouble lies ahead....'
'We have caught them unawares! To arms!'
'Those half-trolls are too heavy on their feet... we shall be ready for them!'
'Leave them to tend their dead... their own ends shall come soon enough.'
'We were foolish to tarry so long on the fields... we should have been ready for this assault!'
'Garvir should not have to suffer our folly!'
'Brother!'
'Garvir...'
'Enough of this! I will not allow Garvir to come to harm!'
'Wait! I hear them coming, brother.'
'I will not retreat from such a broken force! Slay them all!'
'You are fortunate indeed that I came only for him.'
'Yet, when the Scourge claims Pelargir, I shall return and claim Linhir as my home.'
